author: JamesWTruher
body:
## Steps to reproduce

```
[System.Management.Automation.Cmdlet("Get", "Thing", ConfirmImpact = 'High', SupportsPaging = $true)]class C2{}
$t = [C2].GetCustomAttributes($false)
$t
```

From Scripting.Classes.Basic.Parsing.Tests.ps1
## Expected behavior

```
NounName                : Thing
VerbName                : Get
DefaultParameterSetName :
SupportsShouldProcess   : False
SupportsPaging          : True
SupportsTransactions    : False
ConfirmImpact           : High
HelpUri                 :
RemotingCapability      : PowerShell
TypeId                  : System.Management.Automation.CmdletAttribute
```
## Actual behavior

```
Exception calling "GetCustomAttributes" with "1" argument(s): "'ConfirmImpact' property specified was not found."
At line:1 char:9
+         $t = [C2].GetCustomAttributes($false)
+         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [], MethodInvocationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CustomAttributeFormatException
```
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.10032.0
PSEdition                      Linux
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v0.5.0-217-g9c9161febac5fc433d1987e75d8ba9b18fd286c1
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion              1.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1


```

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
@daxian-dbw @andschwa hey guys, I verified that this regression was introduced in #1235

Build for bd21c84ece16484d6e4722f754ae11961d5c20da
is https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/0.5.0.2775/artifacts
Doesn't repro

Build for ef32e2339ed04e52ecbad1bcc13c8121af88cc5f is https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/0.5.0.2789/artifacts
Repros

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: This issue has something to do with the new ALC model. I have brought up this to CoreCLR team.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: This is a reflection bug in CoreCLR. It has been reported to CoreCLR team.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @SandeepSutari I think we need to move this issue to future. This is a reflection bug in CoreCLR and it won't be fixed in the near future.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
Fixed via PR #2472

This was caused by a bug in `AssemblyLoadContext` -- dynamic assemblies are not correctly associated with the right load context. This has been fixed in the .NET Core preview packages for Nov. release (1.1.0).

Now it works fine:

```
PS C:\> [System.Management.Automation.Cmdlet("Get", "Thing", ConfirmImpact = 'High', SupportsPaging = $true)]class C2{}
PS C:\> $t = [C2].GetCustomAttributes($false)
PS C:\> $t

NounName                : Thing
VerbName                : Get
DefaultParameterSetName :
SupportsShouldProcess   : False
SupportsPaging          : True
SupportsTransactions    : False
ConfirmImpact           : High
HelpUri                 :
RemotingCapability      : PowerShell
TypeId                  : System.Management.Automation.CmdletAttribute

PS C:\>
PS C:\>
PS C:\> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.10-136-g001f6ecf72481e59e6f81e0f06f59a3e8a6dd587
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
CLRVersion

PS C:\>
```

title: GetCustomAttributes fails to retrieve CmdletAttribute with ConfirmImpact property
